Detailed Description

template<class ObjectType>
class stDBMMemNode< ObjectType >

This class template implements a memory shell for a stDBMNode instance. It implements a memory optimized node wich simulates the physical occupation of the original node.

Since all objects are stored using their implementation (not the serialized form), this class is very useful to optimize heavy object manipulations such as MinMax algorithms.

By the other side, this class will unserialize all objects of the node without exceptions. Due to that, the use of this class is not recommended for procedures with low rate of object unserializations/serializations. Another disadvantage of this class is the potential high memory usage.

Author:
Marcos Rodrigues Vieira (mrvieira@icmc.usp.br)
See also:
stDBMNode

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

template<class ObjectType>
stDBMMemNode< ObjectType >::stDBMMemNode (  stSize  pageSize,
stCount  numberOfEntries = 32
) 
 

Creates a new instance of this class. The parameter page is an instance of stPage that hold the node data.

The parameter create tells to stPage what operation will be performed. True means that the page will be initialized and false means that the page will be used as it is. The default value is false.

Parameters:
page The page that hold the data of this node.
create The operation to be performed.

template<class ObjectType>
stDBMMemNode< ObjectType >::~stDBMMemNode (   )  [inline]
 

Release all resources associate.

Member Function Documentation

template<class ObjectType>
int stDBMMemNode< ObjectType >::AddEntry (  stSize  size,
ObjectType *  object,
stPageID  subTree
) 
 

Adds a new entry to this node. This method will return the idx of the new node or a negative value for failure.

This method will fail if there is not enough space to hold the new object.

If you have added a new entry successfully, you may edit the entry fields using the method GetEntry().

Parameters:
size The size of the object in bytes.
object The object data.
Warning:
The parameter size is not verified by this implementation unless __stDEBUG__ is defined at compile time.
Returns:
The position in the vector Entries.
See also:
RemoveEntry()

Returns:
stEntry the reference of the desired entry.
